The stylist smiled, "You two are adorable you know that? I wish my boyfriend was that committed to see me happy. He's nice and all, but he's not as selfless as you."

This made you blush, and you saw Alisha was still sitting across from you, making sure the stylist did things right. You felt the stylist wash out the product finally, and the warm water rushing through your wet hair and tickling your scalp felt amazing. You had to admit this was an interesting experience, soothing almost. The stylist had very gentle hands, and soft flawless skin that she obviously spent a lot of care on. As she rubbed the product out of your hair, her hands on your scalp felt really nice.
1231122.title: The stylist starts to chat with you while worki...

choices: You get the dainty feminine hands of the hair stylist.
You get the stylists flawless soft skin over your whole body and face.
You swap something else with the stylist.
12311221.content: Your mind began to drift, concentrating on the stylists soft hands rubbing your scalp, and running her fingers through your hair. In your carelessness, you once again accidentally swapped something.
12311221.title: Accidentally swap hands or skin with the stylist.

choices: Get feminine hands and soft skin from the stylist.
Swap a mental trait with the stylist.
Swap some other body part with the stylist.
123112213.content: Or maybe it's even worse, you end up swapping both hands AND skin with the stylist? Or maybe something else, entirely, like a mental trait or a body part? We shouldn't dawdle on choices too long, there's a story to be written...
123112213.title: You swap something else with the stylist.

choices: It turns out really well, its stylish but also a somewhat unisex style.
It turns out extremely feminine looking, but Alisha approves of it.
She isn't finished, Alisha wants her to add dye or highlights.
1231122131.content:
Your mind began to drift, concentrating on the stylists soft hands rubbing your scalp, and running her fingers through your hair. In your carelessness, you accidentally triggered your power again. You didn't even notice anything had changed right away, until you felt the stylist's hands were no longer very soft and gentle. It felt like she had man hands almost, and coarse skin. She could still do her job just fine, but it wasn't nearly as pleasurable as before.

At the same time however, the skin across your whole body felt so much more fresh and alive. All your pores were clean and open, and later you would discover that you had a faint flowery scent about your body. At the moment you still assumed that was hair product smell. Another thing you had yet to discover was that your hands were now that of a woman's, thin and elegant. You didn't have long nails or anything that would look out of place, but your nails were definitely taken care of well, with very slight white tips at the ends of them. Normally your nails were short and scraggly, but these hands definitely looked like they belonged to a woman.

The stylist had finished washing your hair and was now trimming the split ends and shortening some areas to create layers and volume. She saw your hands folded together on your lap and was intrigued. "Oh I guess you won't be needing our manicure treatment, you already have wonderful nails! I mean for a guy of course. Don't feel self conscious, we give manicures to men too, and they love it, there's nothing weird about it trust me."

You were confused as to why she brought this up, since your nails were never anything impressive. And then you finally looked down to see the soft feminine hands that were now yours. That would explain why her hands felt so different on your scalp now...

"Umm... thanks? I guess they're just naturally like this... plus Alisha convinced me to start using her hand lotion and it really works as you can see..." You lied once again, trying to fit in with the new reality changes.

"Well it's certainly working well. Looks like you do the same to your face, I can tell you exfoliate! It's great that you listen to your girlfriend about maintaining a healthy appearance." The stylist commented, as she began getting out what looked like a professional hair straightener.

Alisha interjected again. "Oh Billy's just being modest don't listen to him. The skin cleansers were actually his idea! He actually was the one to introduce me to them!"

As the stylist began straightening your hair, you felt some of it fall against your skin and it was like smooth as silk! You had no idea your own hair could feel this good against your skin, and you realized your new soft skin probably helped a lot too. You found you were enjoying this far more than you anticipated... Not due to any kind of personality changes, but it was just simply a new experience for you.

Once the straightening was done, she started brushing the hair and using oils to add shine and volume to it. You were still not allowed to see yourself in the mirror yet however, so you couldn't tell how you looked. You were afraid this hairstyle would end up looking weird or girly, but at the same time you trusted the stylist to do something that made sense. She knew you were a guy so this couldn't end up that bad, could it?
1231122131.title: Get feminine hands and soft skin from the stylist.

choices: You get home and flaunt your hair to Alex.
12311221311.content:
Finally the stylist finishes, and you are given a mirror to see the results. In the end it turned out better than you expected. It wasn't a particularly feminine style, and you could probably get away with looking like you were in a rock band of some kind. Your long brown hair had been straightened and layered, but was cleanly out of your face with no annoying bangs.

"Wow, I like it! It's so soft and clean but, it looks a lot less girly than I expected, good job!" You said as you looked at your new hairstyle from all angles. You really were impressed.

You also noticed your face looked a bit different, from getting the woman's skin. Your face looked flawless, and your skin tone had even tanned ever so slightly, in a creamy tan kind of way. You considered swapping it back, as well as her hands, but you saw no harm in it. The woman still seemed to be competent at her job without her feminine hands and skin, and they felt so good, she wouldn't miss them anyways.

"Thank you sir, this was a fun experience for me as well. I rarely get a chance to work on men's long hair, and I kind of made up this style as I went along, trying to keep it from getting too feminine. I hope you don't mind, but I used a new product on it that I've never tried on men before, and I'm going to give you a discount for helping me try it out. From what I can tell it did wonders in making your hair shiny smooth!" The stylist said as she tallied up the bill, and handed it to you.

It was expensive, but this was apparently 50% off compared to her normal price! You considered yourself lucky to have the discount.

"Oh thanks, yeah it seems to have worked well, I don't mind. There's no weird side effects right?" You asked, handing over your credit card.

"Oh no, it should be fine, just make sure to maintain it well. When you sleep tonight, you need to make sure you are gentle with it for the first 24 hours or you might ruin the style before it settles in. Here is the bottle I used, it's a styling cream for men's long hair, so it shouldn't have any fruity girly scents or anything. Just make sure to use before you sleep tonight, and again tomorrow morning, and then every two days after that. A quick rub through should do it, and then simply use a wet towel to absorb the rest. I hope I don't have to tell you this, but of course you also need to make sure to use the correct shampoo and conditioner..." She said, starting to ramble on.

You had no idea maintaining a hairstyle would be so much work, but you nodded and agreed to whatever she said. You were beginning to zone out until you noticed she was done speaking, and then you smiled. You looked at her nametag, which read 'Janice.'

"Thank you Janice, this was an interesting experience for me, I'm glad my girlfriend dragged me down here now. Maybe I will see you again next time I need something done!" You said with a smile and left.

Alisha seemed quite pleased with how it turned out, and gave you a sweet kiss on the lips outside the store. "See? I knew you would like it! You're going to remember to do all that stuff right? It's not easy taking care of a professional hairstyle."

"Of course, it doesn't sound too hard, I can handle it." You assure her. You both get in her car and Alisha drives back to your house.
12311221311.title: It turns out really well, its stylish but also ...

choices: Something strange happened with your hair.
Your hair looks fantastic as ever.
Something weird happened, unrelated to your hair.
123112213111.content:
The rest of the day went by fairly normal, Alisha and you spent some time hanging out at home, doing your usual thing, and then she had to leave. She lived with her parents still and they didn't want her staying over at your house for some reason.

Before you went to sleep, you decided if you were going to keep this hair for a while you might as well try to do what the stylist had said. You weren't really paying attention to the whole thing, because you assumed you'd just swap the hair away, but for some reason you hadn't yet done so.

"Ok what did she want me to do again...? Use this bottle right?" You said as you unscrewed the bottle and a strange scent came out. "Whoa this stuff is strong. She wasn't joking about it not smelling flowery..."

You rubbed it through your silky hair, making sure you got to every strand. You remembered she said something about a towel, and so you made sure to wipe the rest down and it seemed pretty good! With your hair mostly dried off and free of cream, you crashed in bed and went to sleep. When you wake up...
123112213111.title: Skip to tomorrow morning.

choices: Clumps of hair were beginning to fall out!
Your hair was much longer than yesterday, and it looked like a different color?
Oops, that was body soap, you really need to wake up.
1231122131111.content: When you woke up, you immediately went to take your morning shower, like every day. You were still half asleep, and almost forgot that you now had long hair. You felt the hair tickling your shoulders and remembered the stylist had told you to use the right products every day to make sure it looked good. You shrugged, and figured it couldn't hurt. However when you ran your shampooed fingers through your hair, you realized something was off...
1231122131111.title: Something strange happened with your hair.

choices: Swap your hair with the stylist, see how she likes it.
Swap all of the stylists knowledge on beauty care, ruin her career.
Don't swap anything, get revenge legitimately by exposing her mistake.
12311221311111.content:
You woke up quickly, from the shock of feeling clumps of your long hair in your hand. As you shampooed, more was falling out and you were beginning to panic, this wasn't supposed to happen!

You quickly washed the remaining shampoo out, and got out of the shower and towel dried your hair. By the time it was dry, a lot of it had visibly fallen out already. There was in fact, not much left but a few patches here and there.

"Shit, shit shit! What the fuck did that stylist do?! This is Alisha's hair how dare she!" You yelled into the mirror, horrified by what you were seeing.

You thought if anything went wrong you could always give it back to Alisha, but this was horrible! There was no way you could give her this hair now! You looked at the bottle that you used last night and finally realized what was happening. The stylist had given you a bottle of hair removal. You weren't sure if this was an accident or if she had something against you, but you were furious. If this was your own hair this would be fine, since you could just shave it short again. But this was your girlfriend's hair the stylist had fucked with!

With all the noise you were making, your sister Alex figured something was up. She knocked on the bathroom door, "Hey Billy, everything ok in there?"

You sighed, "No everything's not ok!"

You wrapped a towel around your lower half and opened the door, revealing your destroyed hair to Alex. At first, she wasn't sure what was going on, and then she burst into laughter.

"Oh my god! I'm sorry I shouldn't laugh but... wow that looks so retarded. What the hell happened? I thought you went to that stylist your girlfriend loves? Your hair looked amazing yesterday." Alex said, apparently not caring that she only had short hair in a male cut.

"The bitch at the salon gave me hair removal instead of styling cream! I trusted her!" You yelled, showing the bottle.

Alex looked at it and nodded, "Yeah that'll do it, I can't believe she would mess up that badly though. You think she did this on purpose? Was she upset with you?"

"I can't imagine why she would do it on purpose unless she just likes watching the world burn. Either way, she needs to pay for what she did to Alisha's hair." You said, not thinking what you were saying.

Your sister raised an eyebrow, "Alisha's hair? What about yours? Did she fuck with Alisha's hair also?"

"Uh.. I mean I don't want Alisha going back there, what if this lady messes up her blonde locks? Alisha loves her hair way too much it would devastate her." You quickly correct yourself.

Alex seems to buy this, and agrees. "Yeah you should at least get your money back, maybe get a free wig out of it too, this is pretty serious. You could really hurt her business if you wanted to."

Alex was right, you needed to get revenge.
12311221311111.title: Clumps of hair were beginning to fall out!

choices: No turning back now, she is careless and doesn't deserve to be a stylist.
You can't go through with ruining her career, just swap hair and be done with it
Be a rational person and talk to the lady about what happened.
123112213111112.content:
You decided it would be best for you to put on a hat before leaving the house in this embarrassing state. It hid most of the missing patches of hair luckily. You hopped in your car and drove down to the hair salon, hoping the same woman would be working today. You walked into the salon with your baseball cap hiding your scalp, and the remaining strands tucked inside the hat.

You were in luck, the woman from yesterday was currently working on a woman's hair and was quite distracted and hadn't noticed you come in. You took a moment before revealing yourself, to have a look around at the bottles of hair product that were at the counter, trying to see what she should have given you. And there it was, the styling cream in a purple bottle. There were several of them next to each other, but mixed in among them was a single purple bottle of hair removal cream which was identical to the bottle you used last night. You supposed it was an easy mistake, since the bottles looked so similar and someone must have stocked them in among the proper product...

Do you accept this honest mistake and forgive her? Or is it too late, you've gone too far, and it's time to go through with your plan? It is still her fault for not checking the label first.
123112213111112.title: Swap all of the stylists knowledge on beauty ca...

choices: Yes, as an intern, and now you're her boss?!
Yes, but she's probably going to get fired without any skills.
No, she shouldn't even be here, why is she styling someone's hair still?
1231122131111121.content:
You couldn't forgive her mistake. This could have been Alisha's hair, or even Alex's hair when she was still blonde! You had to stop this woman from hurting anyone else with her carelessness.

With some concentration, you thought about all the years of training and practice this woman had in order to become a master stylist. You swapped these skills with your complete lack of knowledge on the subject, limited to only what you've learned by watching girls do their hair, which wasn't much at all. You then made sure NOT to swap her carelessness to yourself, and leave her with that flaw.

You felt something happen in your mind, it was like new memories were appearing in your head. Four years of going to college to be a beautician, years of growing up around girl friends and trading lip gloss and hair spray in high school. Stealing your mom's makeup and making a fool of yourself, before she taught you how to use it properly. This woman's entire life experience with hair and cosmetics were now part of your life. You felt deep down that you'd actually experienced all of these things and that these memories were yours. Of course you were aware of the swap you'd just made... but it didn't matter to you. These were your memories, they didn't come from some swap.

When you saw yourself in the mirror, it was almost like a totally different person. You were no longer wearing a baseball hat to cover up your hair, because your hair no longer needed to be covered up. You still had Alisha's long brown hair, but it was styled completely differently than before. No longer did you have a cool unisex style, but now a full on women's hair style with swept bangs and blonde highlights throughout. There were even streaks of red mixed in, and according to your memories, you knew exactly how you did all of this. This was your own style that you'd designed yourself, not by some salon.

Not only was your hair different, but you could swear you saw some makeup on your soft perfect skin as well. You were wearing eyeliner and a subtle coat of lipstick, as well as a hint of eye shadow. If hadn't recognized the facial structure as your own, you would swear this person in the mirror was a woman. She looked beautiful as well, as attractive as years of beauty school could teach. In this reality you seemed to have no problem styling yourself as a woman, and noticed that even your clothes were slightly more stylish, though they were not feminine clothes, just gender-ambiguous.

As for the stylist well, she was in the middle of trying to style this lady's hair, but her appearance had changed drastically. She looked like she had poorly attempted to make herself look nice, with no knowledge of beauty whatsoever. You wondered how she even still had a job here... Wait, does she still have a job here?
1231122131111121.title: No turning back now, do the swap!

choices: Stop off at Mac Donalds on the way home
12311221311111213.content:
You realize that styling hair and the other beauty related tasks that the stylist does is allot more fun and more lucrative than working at MacDonalds which is what you do. So you switch jobs with her.

You plan on keeping this job until you finish college yourself. It is perfect since you can set your own hours and you like that you are surrounded by pretty women who will admire you for your skills.

"Stop!!!" you shout. The 'former stylist' freezes with a sizzor and comb in her hand. "What are you doing?" you demand.

The 'former stylist' doesn't indeed know why she is here. "Get away from her." and she did. She slung away and out of the shop. But before she left, you decided to inflict one last indignity on her. You swap her hair with the elderly woman whose hair she had been working on. The elderly woman's hair became fuller and returned to its original color. Whereas the former stylist hair became all white and much thinner. It was styled in an old woman's perm which contained enough hair stray to keep her scalp dry in a thunder shower. (Even her her pubic hair had turned white.)

"I'm sorry about that," you told the woman who with younger hair looked ten or fifteen years younger even though you haven't completed her style yet.

"No problem," she said and then she continued the story she was telling the original stylist. You found the story very boring. She continued for a while as you mocked interest. You realized that knowing and liking these type of stories would make your days go much faster so you removed, the woman's lifetime worth of stories and replace them with your knowledge of the video games you played along with all the techniques and cheats you had learned over the year.

"As you were saying?" you asked the woman.

"Do you mind if I just sit here quietly while you finish me up?" She was now as bored with the story as you had been.

"No problem dear, you said as you went to work on her hair. This was your first real styling attempt despite having the knowledge of over a decade of professional styling experience. You were going to give this woman more than her money's worth.

When you were done, you checked your appointment book. You saw your next appointment would be here soon, but in an hour you had a break. It was at that time that you made changes to your schedule which allowed for your college schedule. This took a while as you had to call many women, several of which didn't want their appointment changed. It took a while but you fixed your schedule in such away to allow for your classes without alienating your best clients.
12311221311111213.title: No, she shouldn't even be here, why is she ...

choices: Teach her the obvious lesson by swapping voices with her.
Continue to put up with her bullshit, you don't want to make a scene.
123112213111112132.content:
As the day went by, you found yourself really enjoying this new job. Of course to you, it was like your dream job, having studied for years to be good at what you did. You had one more appointment scheduled before you had to leave for class, and it was a woman in her 30's who walked into the salon talking on the phone. She barely made eye contact with you, and looked away in disgust when she did. It was possible she realized you were a man despite the feminine hair and makeup, or it could be that she thought you were a flat chested woman. You paid her little mind either way, as you showed her to her seat, though she went there as though she'd been here a thousand times.

"So what would you like done today ma'am? Your appointment says you're here to touch up your roots, looks like some dark hair is showing. Did you want anything else done while we're at it?" You ask the woman in a polite manner.

She still hadn't hung up her phone, talking on a bluetooth headset while you were getting things prepared. "Huh? Oh yeah just read what it says on the appointment jeez, can't you see I'm having a conversation? Yeah that was just the stylist asking dumb questions again. Yeah that stylist. I know right?" She said with a bubbly laugh.

You give her a dirty look but begin washing her hair anyways. A job was a job right? You would have to put up with people like this from time to time, so you'd have to get used to this now. It certainly didn't help that there were bigoted people out there who would judge you based on appearance and assume the worst. To most people it was obvious there was something different about you.

When you went to rinse her hair over the basin, you realized she still had the stupid bluetooth thing in her ear, and didn't want to damage it. "Excuse me, miss, do you mind taking out your bluetooth, it's probably going to get wet in a second." You warned her.

"What? I'm on an important phone call, can't you just, I don't know, wash around it? I bet you get mistaken for a man on the phone quite a lot don't you? While you're washing, take notes, this is how normal people talk, sweetie." The woman rudely said in an exaggeratedly feminine way of speaking, obviously mocking your deeper voice.
123112213111112132.title: A rude customer

choices: The woman was rude again (more swapping)
Everything goes well with her tint
1231122131111121321.content:
“I’m sorry miss, I just can’t ensure that the water won’t splash form the device and damage it,” you inform here, in the same unmistakably feminine voice the rude woman had had moments before. She looked at you much more timidly, she mumbled a reply, but you couldn’t hear it, “What was that? I couldn’t hear you, miss,” you said, poignantly using the same high timber she had used to mock you before. “I said that I’m sorry,” said the rude lady, noticeably embarrassed by her voice as she heard how feminine yours was. To her, she had always had a deep voice and it always embarrassed her when she was around people with the kind of voices she figured she should have, namely your new voice. “Not to worry,” you told here as you finished the washing her hair. “Now, if you’ll follow me to the chair over here we can get started on covering those roots,” you motioned once you were done.

The woman quietly made her way to your station, it wasn’t until she had sat in your chair that you noticed slight differences in her attire and here make-up. The make-up just a tad heavier and the cut of the clothes a notch tighter, as if trying to compensate for the deeper voice. It was hard to tell with the robe she had already put on before the hair wash, but it seemed to you that her chest might be bigger than when she walked in. You got what you needed for the tint together and …
1231122131111121321.title: Teach her the obvious lesson by swapping voices...

choices: It's a choir class. You now have the voice to join Alisha in her favorite hobby!
It's drama/acting, you convinced Alisha to take this as an elective with you.
It's just a general math class Alisha needs for her Physics degree.
12311221311111213212.content:
You began the process of dying her roots to match the rest of her blonde hair. She obviously wasn't a natural blonde, and had taken great effort to hide that fact, given that she had barely any roots visible today. The woman was fairly agreeable after this, and let you do your job finally, with no more interruptions from her phone.

"All done ma'am, how does it look?" You asked, enjoying your new feminine voice. It sounded much more pleasant coming out of your lips than hers.

"It's very good, thank you..." The woman said curtly, not wanting to hear her deep voice very long.

She didn't leave a tip, but she paid without making a scene and finally left. You breathed a sigh of relief that you avoided that potential train wreck. Now that your final appointment for the day was finished, you could finally head off to class. You said goodbye to the other stylist you were now working with, and of course she reacted as though you'd been working there for years, smiling and waving you off.

Once at school, you met up with Alisha, who shared a class with you today. It was odd going to college since you now had the memories of four years as a Cosmetics Major, and even had the degree to prove it, thanks to the reality change. But apparently you were now going back to school to get a second degree in drama, and cinema costume design. This was very different from your previous major in engineering, but you realized you'd traded all of those skills away in return for all this knowledge on hair and beauty.

"Billie! There you are! Almost late for class huh?" Alisha ran up to you waving. You smiled when you saw her now blonde hair fluttering in the wind, courtesy of Alex.

"Hey Alisha, I was busy finishing up at work." You said with a smile, and brushed some of your own long hair out of your face.

"Well this is the only class we ever have together so I was hoping you wouldn't miss it." She said as you both took a seat.

It took you a moment to realize this was not the usual class you two had together, reality had once again changed due to previous swaps...
12311221311111213212.title: Everything goes well with her tint

choices: Alisha invites you to open mic night at a local bar
Another student is rude to both of you
123112213111112132121.content:
It didn’t take long for you to realize that you were in Choir class, Alisha’s favorite class. “Common Billie, we can do our vocal exercises together,” Alisha enthused. At first you were unsure of what to do, but you figured you could just copy what she was doing, to your great surprise you were a very good singer. Your new voice was able to hit notes in the very top registers and you were actually having fun just doing the vocal exercises.

The professor called everyone to attention after a while and had you all practice an arrangement for an upcoming performance. You thoroughly enjoyed singing along with Alisha and she seemed to really enjoy sharing her hobby with you. In this reality it was apparently one of the things that had brought you together.

After class …
123112213111112132121.title: It's a choir class. You now have the voice ...

choices: Make a swap with the woman
Swap something of the woman with someone else
1231122131111121321212.content:
After Class you and Alisha were getting ready to head out when another student bumped into you, “Excuse me?!” you said indignantly. “Oh, you are excused,” she replied with disdain. She looked at you as one would some wretched creature on the street. “Do you have a problem my boyfriend, uh, Christina?” asked Alisha, defensively. “Oh, why would I have a problem with this pathetic excuse for a joke? Aren’t we all supposed to be accepting of everyone? Aren’t we supposed to welcome all the freaks and all the creeps as normal now?” Christina said, with air quotes. “What are you talking about?” you asked, more than a bit annoyed at that point. “Don’t you get it? You. Are. A. Freak! Look at you, you and your girlfriend disgust me. You are not a man, you’re not a woman, you’re a Freak!”

You knew that with all the swaps and changes you weren’t quite the man you used to be, but Alisha and you seemed closer than ever before, you shared so much in common now and you honestly liked your new self, the core of who you are hadn’t changed, but you were still in love with Alisha and Alisha was still in love with you. But to be called a freak like that was not pleasant in the least, more than a bit rude in fact.

Alisha looked at you as if to apologize for Christina somehow and you felt anger at the woman’s outdated and hurtful words. Wrapped up in the moment you ...
1231122131111121321212.title: Another student is rude to both of you

choices: Margaret and her mother outside the salon
1231122131111121322.content:
While you were dealing with this woman, another woman in her early forties came up to you. She was here with her daughter who looked to be eighteen or nineteen years old.

"Excuse me," she said. "How long will you be? I came here with my daughter and I have to get back soon." She indicated her daughter who was sitting quietly with her hands in her lap looking down at the floor. "You see my daughter doesn't drive and can't come alone."

"Oh, this will be simple. I'll only be a few minutes."

"Fine, I'll be gone for a few minutes, you let me know if my daughter is any trouble while I am gone." You could tell that this overbearing mother was dominating the life of her poor daughter and you felt sorry for her. The woman in your chair on the other hand you had no sympathy for. So you changed the relationship between the three of them.

"Excuse me before you go, your daughter refuses to take the phone out of her ear so I can wash her hair." The rude woman was now the daughter of the overbearing mother, despite there being less than a decade of age between them.

"Oh, she won't will she???" Then to the woman in the salon chair. "Margaret Marie Crenshaw you take the phone out of your ear this instant."

"Mother, I will not, it's an important call."

"Do it this instant or else."

Margaret looked at her 'mother' incredulously. Margaret was old enough to do as she pleased. But her mother was having none of it. She reached fore the bluetooth in Margaret's ear and pulled it out. Margaret sat there in shock. Then her mother grabbed her by her earlobe and forced her out of the chair. Margaret had to comply due to the pain.

Then to you, which Margaret completely controlled. "I don't know what came over her, but I promise it'll be better next time. We are leaving now, I'll phone you to make another appointment."

"OK," was all you could say.

Then to Margaret, "Say your sorry!!!"

"I will not," was Margaret's reply. Her mother then forced her out of the salon.

------------------------------------------------

Two weeks later, Margaret was back for another appointment. She came in with her mother. She looked different. her eyes were downcast and she wasn't dressed like the stylish woman that she was two weeks before. She was wearing a fleece shirt that contained a large multicolored "Heart' with matching pants. On her feet were tennis shoes with white anklets. It looked like her clothes were from the girl's department of the local Kmart.

Glaring at Margaret, the mother said, "What do you say?"

"I'm sorry," Margaret said not taking her eyes off the floor..

"Sorry for what?"

"I'm sorry for not listening to you."

"And???"

"...and it'll never happen again."

"Good now you site there and be quiet while we talk." Then to you, "It's been such a tough couple of weeks, but it's all better now. Margaret was hanging out with the wrong crowd and I put a stop to that."

In fact, Margaret now didn't have any friends at all and spent all the time she wasn't working with her mother who dominated her life. Margaret was being controlled by her mother even more than the original girl had been since Margaret was more defiant. Her mother broke down all resistance and took over her life. The mother moved into Margaret's apartment and took over the master bedroom, relegating Margaret to the guest room. She then went about taking over Margaret's entire life. She broken down her resistance and segregated Margaret from all of her friends. Soon she was in complete control. Margaret didn't even call her mother anymore, it was strictly mommy from now on. Margaret wasn't even allowed to keep the money she earned at her job. She had to give the entire paycheck to her mother and her mother would decide if Margaret could have this or that.

"I am sorry about my daughter last time, I don't know what came over her. She's not a bad girl, she just needs direction. Everything is fine now that I am making all her decisions. OK, now for the haircut this is what I want." Margaret's mother described a style which included braids that even though they weren't pig tails you wouldn't find on a girl older than ten or eleven. Then she told you to file her nails short and put on nail polish in a bright pink that would be common place in a junior high school. Finally, she decided that all of Margaret's pubic hair should be removed leaving the woman baby smooth down below.

You started on your assignment confident in the fact that Margaret would not be rude to anyone ever again.

12311221313.content:
Alisha loved your new style. "You know what, I think we should dye your hair blonde like mine."

"What???"

"Oh, just kidding, I don't want you to be prettier than me with a mock smile. "But I do think a little highlights would help you."

"I don't know." you said.

"Oh, trust me!" she said.

"Well.."

"We have come this far, let's go all the way."

You didn't say anything and so the stylist started adding highlights to your hair. You didn't protest too much because you knew that you could just 'dump' you hair off on your sister and get your own hair back. That was what you planned to do. You actually thought you were doing your sister a favor by getting 'her' hair fixed up so nicely. Or would you give this style to Alisha and give your sister back her own hair color and style. This is what kept your mind busy as the stylist was working on your hair.

"What do you think?" the stylist asked Alisha.

"Well its very nice but I think we are missing something." and then Alisha whispered something to the stylist.

"I see what you mean." and then the stylist told you to close your eyes. At this point she tweezed your eyebrows. She didn't give them feminine arcs but she did make them allot neater.

When she was done they showed you what you looked like. It was you. You could see yourself, but between the hair and the new feminine skin and the eyebrows you could be mistaken for a woman despite not having any makeup on at all.

You stood there in shock.

"You look great!!!" Alisha enthused. She was so involved with the procedure and she knew you were a man she didn't even realize how feminine you now looked.

The stylist then hands you the bill.

Alisha takes you back home, to make your sister Alex jealous of your hair.
123112213132.content:
You were shocked at how feminine you now looked, with all the changes, and you realized that accidentally swapping skin hadn't helped one bit. You held the bill printout in your now feminine hand and were shocked at how much it cost. But the stylist had done such an amazing job that you would feel guilty getting mad over the price. In the end, if you wanted to change back you knew you could always return this hair style to Alisha and give your sister back her blonde hair, and then Alisha would be better off for it. So it was worth the money to you.

You looked again at the mirror and you really had trouble even recognizing yourself, but you found yourself smiling when you saw it. "It's wonderful I love it... I just worry... you think its too girly? I don't want people to mistake me for a girl on the street or anything."

"Oh nonsense, we have male customers with long hair and they love what we do. Sure there might be some rude people out there who think its 'gay' to care about your appearance, but just ignore them. You can be perfectly hetero and have great hair at the same time!" The stylist said.

She rang up your bill and then reached under the counter, pulling out some things. "Since you were such a good customer today, you can have these this bottle of oil and shampoo which you will need to maintain this hair style. I'm sure your girlfriend can help you with the rest, she comes here all the time. Just make sure to come back soon!"

You thanked her with a generous tip and finally left with Alisha. "Well that was an experience... I can't believe you convinced her to give me highlights... Don't you see how girly I look?" You told your girlfriend.

"I thought you might want to experiment? It turned out amazing by the way, and no I don't think you look that girly... I mean a little bit, but it's fine. I think it looks amazing, so just trust me ok?" Alisha said, stroking her hand through your now silky smooth brown hair with blonde highlights.

"I do trust you... I'll try to stop worrying about it I guess. I mean don't get me wrong, I think it looks fantastic, they really outdid themselves, but I just wish it was on a girl's head, and not mine. I do love the way it feels just bouncing around on my head and when my skin touches it, really it's a fascinating experience. I only hope people don't mistake me for a woman now." You said with a shrug.

You finally get back to Alisha's car and wonder where she will take you next. You hoped to just go back home after this whole ordeal, but you weren't sure if she had something planned.
123112213132.title: You accept the change (and pay the bill)

1231122131321.content:
The two of you made your way back to the house, you chit-chatted about how to properly take care of your hair and to your amazement you also seemed to know quite a lot about skin care. It seemed as though the knowledge was coming out of thin air, but it made sense you would know how to achieve the flawless state your skin now enjoyed. After a while the two of you fell silent as one of Alisha’s favorite songs came on the radio. While she sang along to the song you saw a woman with long luxurious hair drive a convertible alongside you. You idly thought about all that she must know to achieve such a luxurious sheen and perfect style all the time, ‘It must take a lot of effort,” you thought, “it does feel nice to have hair like this, but I wonder how I could ever keep it up?” you wonder.
A moment later you notice how the woman’s hair no longer seemed as perfectly done up, it was by no means unkempt, but it no longer had the appearance of hair meticulously maintained. You were surprised by this and in an instant you understand what had happened. “I am so lucky that my boyfriend is also a genius when it comes to beauty care. I mean, who else would keep me looking so fabulous for free,” Alisha enthused. You looked over at her and noticed that she looked slightly different, it was nothing most people would notice, but you knew every inch of Alisha’s body and her skin had never looked so smooth, and her hair looked even more professionally kept. You looked at her with surprise that she mistook for a questioning look. “Well, not completely for free I guess,” she said, winking as she blew you a kiss. You just gave her a slight chuckle and went back to your thoughts.

“Oh, do you mind if we stop by the cosmetics store for a second?” She asked.

“Of course not, whatever you want,” you replied, gesturing absentmindedly, marveling at the smoothness of your feminine hands.

12311221313211.content:
Usually you would have been completely uninterested at a cosmetics store, but now that you had all sorts of knowledge about hair and skin care product swimming around in your head the store was much more appealing. “How about you look for that exfoliating cream you like while I look for a few things?” Alisha asks you.

“I thought I just bought some,” you say, marveling at how the knowledge just seemed to pop into your head.

“I kind of used most of it,” she replies, caressing her smooth skin against yours as she leaves with an impish grin. You wanted to get mad at her, but with that smile you were little more than putty in her hands. She always seemed to talk you into things and if you were completely honest with yourself, you really didn’t mind.

You spend some time looking at different lotions and creams, recalling in almost academic detail how each one worked and which ones would work best for you and Alisha. After getting what you needed you start looking for Alisha. It didn’t take long to find her.

“Hey babe,” she says, with the look of a child caught red-handed. She was getting her makeup done by one of the store makeup artist. “You know, with as much as you know about hair and skin products, it would be great if you also knew about makeup, you’d be the complete package then!” she mentioned. Obviously she meant it mostly as a joke, she had no clue about your powers, but you actually thought it might not be a bad idea. Earlier in the day you wouldn’t have thought about it at all, but after gaining so much knowledge and experiencing some of the benefits it brought you decided to trade makeup skills with the store makeup artist.

A moment later another person, probably a manager appeared next to the makeup artist. “Alright, now apply it to her lips in light dabs,” the manager explained to the former artist, now an apprentice apparently. You looked at the work being done on Alisha and instantly saw some flaws in the technique. At first you thought of letting them finish and correcting it once you left the store, but you were such a perfectionist when it came to makeup now, you couldn’t help yourself. “Excuse me, but if you … and then … with just a light … then to highlight …” you explain, taking over and explaining. By the end, Alisha looks like she just came off a photoshoot and there was a small group of people raptly learning from what you were doing.

“Show off,” Alisha say in mock anger, “I can wipe it off your face if you don’t like it …” you retort with a smile. By the time you two are ready to pay the managers tells you it’s on the house after all the business they made from the people who saw your session earlier.

Soon you’re heading …

123112213132111.content:
You and Alisha got back in the car and while she checked her reflection in the sun-visor’s mirror, you decided to do the same. The person staring back at you was a far sight from what you’d found in the mirror just that morning. Your skin and hair would make most models jealous. Looking down at your hands you are amazed by how feminine they look, with long, elegant fingers and just as smooth as a baby’s bottom. “Are you alright, babe?” asks Alisha, jolting you out of your reverie, “Huh?” you reply, “I know you have beautiful hands, but you’re staring at them like it’s the first time you’ve seen them or something,” she says with a small laugh. “Oh, no, sorry, just got a bit lost in thought,” you say, looking away, a bit frightened that she might somehow know the truth, it was impossible, but she was pretty close to the truth.

Before either of you could say anything further you heard Alisha’s stomach grumble. “Guess you’re hungry, huh?” you ask, with a bit of a smirk. “Yeah, I think it’s time for lunch,” she comments, patting her stomach and giving you a sheepish grin. “Lunch sounds great, what do have in mind?” you ask.

“Oh, I heard of this great fusion restaurant not too far from here, wanna try it out?”

“Sure, sounds fun.”

1231122131323.content:
Alisha drove you to a restaurant. It was a nice Italian restaurant. You knew it was nice since they didn't sell pizza there.

"We can't go there." you said.

"Why not?" Alisha inquired.

"Because I can't afford it, I don't think I have even ten dollars left."

"Don't be silly. It's my treat for being such a good sport. You really look great."

You smile than she adds, "With you so 'pretty' everyone will be envious of my date." You caught the word pretty. You knew she was kidding, but it did rustle your masculinity a bit. You were all man or so you thought. It was also getting late and you had been in the stylist chair for several hours you weren't thinking as clearly as you usually did. Alisha didn't notice that the smile had disappeared from your face since she was leading the way.

Had you given by accident Alisha some of your masculinity? You didn't think so, but that didn't mean you didn't. You hadn't meant to take the stylists soft skin and delicate hands. You really should have given them back immediately, but they felt so good.

Just to be safe, you decide to sap all of Alisha's masculinity out of her. You thought she is a woman she shouldn't have any that didn't come from you and you were just getting back what you had given to her. If you hadn't given her any then nothing would happen.
1231122131323.title: Alisha drives somewhere else...

choices: A woman comments about your pretty hair
12311221313231.content:
With extra masculinity you become much more touchy. Alisha on the other hand just wants you more. She thinks you are so pretty and so rugged at the same time. She can't stop talking about you. She keeps on about how your hair looks great and your face is so pretty that after dinner she would like to get you home and smother you in kisses. This delights your inflated male ego.

There is a small line to get into the restaurant and you are given a beeper to let you know when your table is ready. There aren't any seats to wait in so you and Alisha stand and wait with the crowd. All the while, the more feminine Alisha is trying to build up your ego by fawning over you and your looks. During this time a toddler starts to cry, he was bored and didn't know what to do. This angers you for a moment, but the toddler's mother knew what she was doing and quickly put a pacifier in the toddler's mouth which instantly quieted the boy.

One thing led to another and you was regailing Alisha of a tale to impress her. Alisha was hanging on your every word and you loved it. Then in the middle of a sentence, someone was pushing to get by because their beeper had gone off. The man rudely pushed you you and you said 'Hey.'

The man having seen you from the back with your long pretty hair and seeing your delicate hands from the back had assumed you were a woman. "I'm sorry miss," he said innocently.

"WHO YOU CALLING MISS," you shout back.

He turned to look at you and saw his mistake. Your face might have smooth skin but it was clearing a man's face, especially when he saw the rest of you from the front. On the other hand, you did have some feminine features too. The man was taken aback, and then he said, "I thought you were a woman."

"DO I LOOK LIKE A WOMAN?"

Then that man made a deadly mistake, "Um, sort of." The man assumed that you were a twink and wouldn't be too much trouble.

"I AM NOT."

"I can see that now."

"Then why did you say anything."

"I don't know, I just thought you were a woman. You know you should at least cut your hair if you don't want people to think your a woman!" the man's testosterone was rising. He should have backed off and said he was sorry, but he didn't.

This was the worst thing to say to you at this time, you had just styled your hair and you liked it. Even worse you had spent all your money on it and now this guy was suggesting you cut it all off. "Hey its my hair, I'll do with it what I want."

"And I'll say what I want about it, its a free country. Look....sir" the man stressed the word as if he wanted to use another but couldn't find the right word, "if you don't....

You wanted this man to shut up. You actually wanted to knock his lights out, but Alisha was here and you didn't want to cause her any trouble. Plus if you did you would have to leave. But you wanted the guy to shut is mouth so badly. Then it occurred to you.

Before the man could finish his sentence, he had a pacifier in his mouth and he was wearing the diaper of the formerly crying toddler. He was sucking on it absently, when the man's wife caught up with him.

"I'm sorry about little Joey here, sometimes he just scampers off. You know how kids can be. I hope he didn't bother you too much."

Seeing at how much of a fool you made of the man quelled you anger and you said, "No problem ma'am." Then the two left with the man's wife leading the way holding his hand.
12311221313231.title: You become more aggressive

choices: Attempt to fix Alisha's personality, it's getting on your nerves.
Get angry at her in front of everyone in the restaurant.
Your table is ready just in time!
123112213132311.content:
A woman was sitting nearby, also waiting for her table to be ready, when she watched you get into an argument with a man in a diaper (or so the new reality change had made it) The man's wife had come and quieted him down with his pacifier and left. This woman saw it all go down and decided to attempt to give you a compliment.

"Don't worry about that guy, I think your hair looks great. It's not every day you see a guy who cares about his appearance as much as a woman does. Where did you get it done?" The woman asked.

You were still a bit on edge from the spat with the man and something about the way this woman was talking to you sounded like she was belittling you, or so you thought. Little did you know, transferring all of Alisha's masculinity out of her was a bad idea. Even women had some amount of masculinity, because nobody was 100% masculine or 100% feminine, or at least most people weren't. Turned out this gave you an extra testosterone boost that made you short tempered and very sensitive about your masculine pride. Her comment about your hair got under your skin.

"I... Are you saying I do things like a woman does? Listen you just heard the fight between me and that guy and I'm not in the mood for this right now. I'd rather not argue with an attractive lady like yourself, but you're treading on thin ice here..." You warn her.

She looked at you in disgust and decided to back off and leave it be, offended that you would be so rude at her compliment. Meanwhile Alisha was also looking at you strangely.

"What now?" You snapped at Alisha.

"You think that girl's attractive huh? I'm sitting RIGHT here Bill, I know you were eyeing her." Alisha said, suddenly getting a jealous streak.

Your change had removed any trace of masculinity from her, including the part of her you loved, which was how well she got along with guys. She had always been 'one of the guy's before, playing video games and getting along with your guy friends. But now that she lost that amount of masculinity that most women had, she was suddenly very stereotypically female. While she hung on your every word and was infatuated by you, she also was quick to get jealous just like you were now quick to anger.

"What? Yeah she's kinda cute I guess... Nothing like you of course, you know I love you more than anything babe." You said defensively, realizing you'd slipped up. You weren't used to her being this jealous of other women before, she would have always let that slide as casual conversation.

She gave you a dirty look, "Bill... don't give me that, I know what you meant. You were flirting with her, or at least trying to. You need to apologize."

You started to suspect maybe your change had affected her personality, but you'd never stoop to apologizing to her about this. The lady WAS attractive, there was no denying it, so you weren't going to let Alisha win the argument by apologizing.

You thought women wouldn't have any masculinity, so why would your change cause her to act like this? At first she was acting more feminine than normal, and was infatuated by you. Then she started getting jealous by every woman you even looked at.

Rather than try to deal with Alisha's argument, you decided you could fix this yourself using your new power. You still hadn't figured out how to fully control it, but how hard could it be? You decided to swap half of your masculinity over to Alicia and see what happens...
1231122131323111.title: Attempt to fix Alisha's personality, it'...

Alisha wants to be either 'all male' or 'all female'
12311221313231111.content:
You feel better about yourself, since your persona is much more in line with your physical appearance. It's true you aren't fifty-fifty between male and female but it seems better for you.

Alisha on the other hand, who was physically all woman started to doubt herself. Something didn't sit right within her psyche. She looked at her hands and then got out a mirror to look at her face. It didn't seem right.

"Bill, I have to ask you something seriously," Alisha said with earnest.

"Yes, you can ask me anything."

"Do I look too girlie to you?"

"Too girlie???"

"Yes"

"I don't know what you mean."

"I mean what I said. I think I am too girlie."

"You seem fine to me."

"But I should be more masculine."

"But, you a girl."

"I don't feel like a girl, well not completely."

"How does one feel like a complete girl."

"I don't know. I think I should be less girlie. I think I am going to go to the lady's room and get this stuff off my face, maybe then I'll feel better."

"Feel more masculine?"

"I don't know I just feel right with makeup."

"Would you feel better with a dick?"

"Umm, I don't know, probably not. I just think it would be better if I just wasn't so girlie." Alisha then walked over towards the restrooms. You felt bad for her and you wanted to help her out, but now that you felt in the proper balance (more of less) for yourself you didn't want to give any of your masculinity or more femininity to her.

As she was walking away, you saw the man who you had confronted earlier. He was eating spaghetti with tomato sauce with his hands and making quite a mess. The part of your femininity that contain a maternal instinct found this adorable. But you realized that the man's masculinity was mostly being wasted. You decided if you can't give Alisha any of you physical masculinity you could give her some of his. Do you have her his broad shoulders and general muscular development, the angularity of his face and his general strength. (The strength part didn't matter too much to Alisha you thought, but it would make the man easier to handle by his wife so what the hell. By the time Alisha entered the ladysroom she certainly didn't look 100% female as before. You hoped she would be happy.
12311221313231111.title: You're both equally feminine and masculine ...

Take one of her remaining feminine features for yourself.
123112213132311112.content:
Alisha saw herself in the mirror. A freak... what the hell is wrong with me? She thought to herself.

She looked at herself and saw the odd combination of body types that she had to struggle with her whole life. She was born biologically female, but due to a hormone imbalance, during puberty her skeletal structure grew in more male proportions. Her shoulders broadened, and testosterone helped her develop toned muscles faster than other girls her age. She picked up some feminine habits like making sure her hair was always styled nicely and wore clothing that showed off her chest and ass. Unfortunately she had lost most of her curves when puberty caused her bone structure to grow in a male pattern. This caused her years of being a social outcast in school.

She was sick of trying to exaggerate her femininity, when it didn't really fit her identity. She wiped all her makeup off with a wet towel, and saw something that looked more like her true face. She was done trying to hide.

When Alisha left the bathroom, she found you already seated at a table. You analyzed how she had changed. Her male bone structure, her more angular face, and her muscular appearance, all looked quite odd on her. They weren't freakishly large muscles for a woman, but they were far more than she ever had before. The weirdest part was her shoulders no longer being narrow and feminine. You thought she still looked attractive, she still had the same womanly features where it counted. Her face remained Alisha, but with sharper features than before, only serving to make her look even stranger.

As attractive as you still found her, you could tell she was unhappy. The look on her face was one of a tortured soul. Her entire attitude seemed to have changed from the energetic and optimistic Alisha, to something a bit more somber and reserved.

You felt awful for screwing things up, and wanted to figure out how to help her make things right. You chanced a question, "Are you feeling any better, sweetie? I think you look fine by the way..."

"How do you do it Billy? How are you so comfortable with yourself? You're a man but... you carry yourself so well with a feminine look, at least with your face and hair. I know the hair thing is new to you, but you seem to be handling it quite well." Alisha asked. She seemed to be lost in thought instead of reading the menu.

"I don't know... It was only recently that I started feeling so at peace with myself. Honestly this new hair style was weird at first, but I'm getting used to it quickly. I'm almost tempted to try some more new things to see what else I enjoy. Is there anything you would like to change about yourself... I'm here for you no matter what. I want you to be happy in your own body." You reassured her.

Alisha took a sip of the drink you had ordered for her while she was gone. Her eyes still seemed distant and lost. "I've never told anyone this, but if anyone should know it's you. Some days I wish I had just been born a man. It would be easier, you know? My body was built to be a man, but my sex organs disagree. At this point I honestly don't care if I'm a man or a woman but I wish I could just pick one instead of being some freakish mix of both! Er... sorry for ranting a bit, I got carried away." Alisha apologized.
123112213132311112.title: Alisha wants to be either 'all male' or...

1231122131323111121.content:
You wanted Alisha to be happy. She meant so much to you. If she wanted to be a man than you would give it to her. You can give her your penis and flat ass and other things to make her a man.

This is what you were about to do when you were distracted by the toddler/man stuffing spaghetti into his face. He wasn't totally a man any more but he did have a penis. Then you thought, maybe you should complete giving his masculine features to Alisha, that'll make her happy. You wouldn't swap their face. You couldn't do that, if you did then she wouldn't be Alisha anymore. But everything else could go. The toddler/man wouldn't notice. There is very little difference between how little toddler girls and boys acted anyway.

So you slowly did it, swapping one feature at a time between Alisha and the 'man.' You made sure not to swap anything you had already swapped so Alisha could be all man. You started at the bottom with his feet and moved from there. Finally the last part, you gave the 'man' Alex's long blonde beautiful hair. It was complete now. Then you swapped from yourself most of your masculinity. (You knew what a disaster swapping all of it was before) and Alisha was not a complete man.

Now looking at the handsome man that Alisha had become, you couldn't help but love him. You were emotionally mostly female and so it was natural for you to love the stud that Alisha had become. But more than that you loved him on a deeper emotional level. You didn't realize that this love was actually Alisha's original love for you. In a strange way, you loved Alisha like she used to love you and vice versa.

The gender roles had been completely reversed, but all seemed perfectly normal. It was even proper that Alisha (as the man) was paying for the date..

Then you looked over at the toddler/woman. You could see Alisha in her. Now the toddler had Alisha's body. You recognized it. The shape of her legs and the swell of her breast. Her breasts that wore a bib covered in tomato sauce. Your own maternal instinct found this adorable and you smiled at the site. There she was stuffing spaghetti into her face (not necessarily her mouth) in handfuls, it was so cute.

Originally you thought that giving the man the lifestyle of a toddler was punishment, but with your maternal instinct you didn't see it that way anymore. She'll be a toddler forever but she'll also be taken care of by a loving wife or mommy. All of the man's cares were gone and replaced with baby bliss as all his needs as simple as they might be now would be taken care of. She'd have a happy life of waking up at 8 AM and asleep by 8 PM with naps in the middle. No worries about what to do or where to go, those would be taken care of for him. A life of playing with toddler toys and food already cut up into little bites. You sort of felt envious of his new life now that you saw it with a feminine perspective.

"Billie, Billie???" Alisha said trying to catch your attention.

"What?"

"A penny for your thoughts."

"Oh, I was just looking at that 'little girl' over there," indicating the toddler woman. "I was just thinking that she has it made, a life of simple pleasures and all her needs taken care of. She doesn't even have to worry about going to the bathroom, She can just do it where ever and someone will take care of it for her."

"If you say so. I can tell you that I never liked changing diapers."

"I'm sure you'll make a wonderful father, Alisha."

"Is that an invitation?"

"We'll see."

You and Alisha settle down to have a fine Italian dinner. You and her engage in some small talk. But right now you had bigger issues. Alex was a wreck, and was looking to you for comfort. You had left the restaurant before finishing your meal without even hesitation, if it meant helping your little sister. You just felt an urge to be there for her when she needed you.

You finally arrived at home and opened the door looking for Alex. She was curled up on the couch with her phone and a tub full of ice cream, just as you had predicted. Alisha decided it would be best if he waited outside, and let you handle the family stuff.

"Alex are you ok?" You asked softly, as you entered the room.

"Oh god Billie finally!" Alex leapt up from the chair and embraced you in a hug, wet tears soaking into your jacket. "Why is Paul such a stupid jackass, Billie? Why does he do this to me?!"

You hugged her tightly for some time, reassuring her, "It's ok Alex we'll talk about it, just take a breath."

You both sat down on the couch and set the ice cream in between you, and you humored her by taking turns eating spoonfuls.

"So what happened, why did he break up with you? I thought things were going well between you guys?" You asked.

"Well it was going good for a while, but I always had a feeling he wasn't very attracted to me. You know how I always keep my hair short? He would constantly tell me I should grow my hair longer like every week. I said no I don't like long hair it's too much work! Then I would catch him checking out some of my friends and the other cheerleaders who all have beautiful hair..." Alex said, and continued to ramble some more about about her hair and other girl's hair and how Paul was being an asshole about this.

Normally you would have found this girl talk very tedious, but you found your attention was completely focused on her every word. You were really feeling her emotions now, and almost started tearing up yourself when she told you the next part.

"... So after ALL that! He says we're fucking done, and leaves me alone outside the restaurant! Then when I get home like an HOUR later cause I had to take the fucking bus, I see a pic on Jen's instagram of the two of them hanging out at her house! Ugh why does this happen to me, BIllie?" Alex began crying again, taking an extra large spoonful of ice cream.

You felt yourself getting angry on behalf of your sister, at the way she'd been treated by these people. You were sure it wasn't over something as petty as her hairstyle, but whatever the reason, they were still being terrible to your sister. You had met Jen before, she was on the cheer team with Alex, and the two of them had been friends since highschool. You couldn't imagine she would betray her friend like this by stealing her boyfriend! And Paul wasn't escaping blame either, leaving Alex without a ride after storming out... You and Alisha talked about this stuff many times before, I'm surprised at how open you are around me. I guess it's good that I have a better memory than you." Alex smiled and poked you in the head.

You let all that sink in, finally things were starting to come into place. "Wow… how do you know all this by the way?"

"Well you told me, duh… How did you forget? You and Alisha talked about this stuff many times before, I'm surprised at how open you are around me. I guess it's good that I have a better memory than you." Alex smiled and poked you in the head.



"Well of course I told you, you're my favorite sister. We don't hide things from each other in this family." You smiled back, finally feeling a bit better.

"So… you went there today and her dad freaked out huh…?" Alex brought the conversation back to the problem at hand. "I guess the whole point I was trying to get at was… Alisha wants to have your baby so that her father will finally accept you. But there's no chance of that happening unless you are engaged to marry her."

"What…? But we're not ready for marriage, or kids for that matter." You point out.

"It doesn't matter. Alisha is ready, can't you tell? She's trying to get your baby in her for crying out loud. She wants this!"

"Shit… I don't know after today her dad hates my guts. He's never going to let me anywhere near her." You found that the tears were coming back again, and you thought of a future without Alisha… "I can't keep doing this Alex, I really can't…"

Alex's eyes went wide, "What do you mean you can't do what? What are you talking about?"

Alex however, took this a different way, not knowing that you were referring to swapping, "No! Billie don't ever say things like that. All of those things are who you are! You aren't a guy just because of a thing between your legs. You were the one who explained to me how gender identity works, and now you need to remember. You are a WOMAN. You identify this way, you always have. You chose to dress the way you do, you chose to take hormones at puberty to develop into the female you wanted to be. You had been a girl long before you developed breasts."

Alex continued, "Mom was very supportive of this and went out of her way to even move to a new town so there was no one that remembered you as a little baby boy. Are you just going to throw all of that away because people are rude and bigoted? Alisha's dad doesn't know what you've been through, and he certainly doesn't know how much Alisha loves you."

"But Alex…" You started.

Tomorrow we're getting you a diamond ring and you are going to be ready to propose to her when the time comes!" Alex insisted.

You sat there dumbstruck, staring at your sister who was acting like you'd never seen her act before. Everything she said made sense somehow… but you didn't believe in yourself enough to think that it could ever work. Alex was insistent, but she didn't know the whole picture. You could still fix this with swapping, but at this point that would feel like cheating.

"No… I chose this life, and I'm not going to take the easy way out. I'll just have to fight for it is all…" You said to yourself.

Alex wasn't quite sure what you were talking about, but cheered you on regardless, "Yeah! Fight for Alisha!"

"Thanks sis… I'll think about what you said, but for now I kinda want to be alone." You said, giving her a big hug and going to your room to think and try not to cry again.

That night you gave it a lot of thought, and decided that it would be best to try to fix the remaining swaps before it was too late. You would likely hear from Alisha soon enough, but you weren't sure you were ready to deal with that just yet. You needed time to think about her situation, after all that you'd learned of the way this new reality had played out.

The next morning you chose to avoid jeans, as the women's sizes you now owned were much too constrictive of your male parts. You opted to wear a dress, which felt a little weird, but you liked how comfortable it felt. It was casual, not the kind you would wear to a party, and came down to your knees so there was little risk of anyone getting a peek underneath.

You spent some time at your new job as a stylist's assistant, but you found it didn't really interest you very much anymore. You loved all the training you were getting from Sandi, but you could take it or leave it. Once that was done, you finally showed up for your acting class at school. As usual, you were the star of the class, easily outmatching everyone else in your ability to improvise and had the best stage presence. But you knew this couldn't last.

Once class was done, you once again went on the hunt for April, the girl you acquired all your acting talents from. You were determined to give her back everything you'd taken before the big premiere in just a few days. Once again, you scoured the engineering department for her, noting that her friend said she would be here today.

After some searching, you finally ran into the girl from yesterday studying in the lounge, and asked if she'd seen April. She looked a bit confused, wondering what you were in such a hurry about.

"Umm sure, did you need her for something? If it's urgent I can just call her up if you want. She is getting lunch with friends but should be back soon…" The girl told you.

"Well I could wait around if she's coming back soon." You say, and sit down across from her as she studies. She shrugs and goes back to her book.

You had planned on making some conversation with her, but she seemed buried in the textbook and you felt bad bothering her out of boredom. Eventually you just resorted to checking your phone to see if Alisha had texted you or tried to call, but still nothing… You texted her to ask if everything was alright with her dad, but no response yet.

"Uh, hi there? Who's your friend?" You heard a female voice say from behind you.

You turn around to see who was talking, and you catch a glimpse of a familiar face. You only met the girl one time, but she was very attractive and had a very recognizable face. It was of course April… who was still as beautiful as ever. She was the top actress in the drama class before you stole all of her talent and took her spot in the winter production. Now she was essentially taking all of your classes for you, but hadn't changed her style one bit it seemed.

You turned to face her with confidence, and introduced yourself with a smile. "Oh hi! I'm Billie Hopper, we met once before in another class but you probably don't remember me…"

April looked at you curiously and then her eyes went wide, "Wait, you ARE her! Oh my god I loved you in your last role I was there during the premiere! What are you doing hanging out with us nerds anyway, don't you have rehearsals or something? Not that there's anything wrong with hanging out with us, I just didn't expect to see you here."

"Oh… thanks!" You said, "You actually remember me from that little play? I didn't think many people saw it."

April's friend answered for her, "Well… someone posted a video on YouTube of you seducing the lead actor on stage, and it's been spreading around class lately since you're from our school. You may have overdone it a bit, the guys are being a little immature…"

"Oh… so that's why I was getting so much attention. Did people really like that scene so much?"

April continued, "Well you were practically falling out of that dress, and your body is absolutely killer, so of course the guys loved it. They couldn't give a shit about theater though. I should be truthful though… it was actually me who posted the video, I was the one filming from the front row…" April admitted nervously. You could see her face blushing all of a sudden.

"What…? But I didn't think you'd be into plays after… Why were you there filming?" You asked.

"Well I'm a terrible actress myself, but I've always loved watching plays and supporting the actors by attending, even if it's just a small school production." She said.

"Wow that's really nice of you… So have you ever had any dreams of being an actress? I know you said you're no good at it, but what if I said I could teach you everything I know. Would you take it?" You said with a smirk.

April looked to her friend and they both shrugged, "What you mean you want to tutor me or something? I would love to, but I don’t know… I don't really have the time with classes and everything. And I don't think you understand just how bad I am. I can't even get on a stage without having panic attacks and freaking out. It really wouldn't do me any good…"

"But forget about all that. You have a dream to be an actress don't you? Even if it's an unrealistic one, it's something you’ve always wished was possible…" You asked, pushing the subject.

"Sure I guess… if I didn't have this fear of being on stage maybe I'd be able to learn, but why bother?" April shrugged.

Now you felt pretty guilty about taking away her acting abilities, because you apparently left her with one important thing: her dreams of becoming an actress. Those were still alive in her, despite her complete lack of skill and knowledge about how to do so, which must be kinda depressing for her… You knew what had to be done.

You concentrated on your acting abilities and knowledge of plays and movies and drama, and all the things you learned from her, and swapped them for your old knowledge and hobbies and interests. All of the things that you'd forgotten you'd lost, were now flooding back to your mind. You remembered all your old favorite movies again, the cheesy Sci-fi ones, not the academy award winning dramatic romance movies that April was a fan of.

You also started to remember many things about the engineering building you were in. Who some of the students were, who your professors were, and then came all the knowledge from your years studying engineering here. You had spent a lot of effort to pass these computer and electrical classes, and you couldn't imagine now why you had thrown all that away for… acting.

You looked to April, who was now apparently in as much of a daze as you were, but you knew reality was changing for her, and she wouldn't remember. You saw the girl studying at the table who was April's friend, but she now was looking at April like they'd never met. Somehow you knew this girl's name was Hannah, and she was apparently your friend in this reality now… You knew a few basic things about her like you were the only two 'girls' in your class (she was the only true girl), and you enjoyed hanging out with her between classes while waiting for Alisha. The rest you'd have to learn as time went on.

Meanwhile you decided to figure out what was up with April, "So April uh… you're a drama major then huh? How's rehearsal for the new play coming?"

April looked into the distance with a sad stare, "Huh? Oh I … well they didn't have any parts for me. I really fucked up my audition. I don't know why I'm trying to be an actress when I can't even get on stage without having a panic attack… I'm afraid I might even fail this class."

Oh shit that's what I forgot, her stage confidence… looks like in this reality she's trying to become an actress just can't get over her fears.

With another thought you transferred all of her original stage confidence back to her and swapped back whatever she had which used to be yours. You would now have horrible stage fright, but that was the way you used to be before the swap, so it was only fair…

"I mean, yeah the dress rehearsal went marvelously! I'm so excited for Friday night honestly. You guys will be there to watch me right?" April asked, unsure of why.

"Uh, yeah of course! I'll bring a date with me and we'll be in the front row if possible!" You reassured her.

Meanwhile Hannah wasn't quite sure what was going on, lost in her book, and not even aware of who April was anymore, "Hmm? Oh maybe, I don't know I have a paper to write that night."

April looked a little rejected, but it was ok. In this reality, Hannah and April were complete strangers, though apparently April was treating you like you knew each other somehow, maybe it had something to do with the order in which you swapped things, but now April and Hannah were both your friends, but they were strangers to each other at this point. Sometimes reality changes were a very fickle thing, and you didn't pretend to understand them. You were just happy that April had her lead role in the play again!
