You finally met up with Alex after school, at the mall. You had agreed to at least look at engagement rings for Alisha, but you were still not sure about this. The two of you went as sisters to the jewelry store and began looking around.

"How about this one? It's silver with a pretty elegant design, she would probably like it." Alex pointed to one of the rings on display.

You looked at the price and nearly fell over. "Alex look at the size of the diamond on that thing, there's no way I can afford it!"

That was when a man approached you, who looked like he worked here. "Hello miss, can I help you today? You seem to be eyeing the engagement rings. I assume there's a special guy in your life?" The man said with a smile.

You were going to pretend that there was a guy, but Alex spoke up first, "Hi! My sister here is looking for an engagement ring for her girlfriend. They've been together for like what… four years now? I told her it's about time she proposes!"

"Alex! Shut up!" You protested.

The man gave you a curious look, "Girlfriend huh? I can say that's a first for my store. You know gay marriage isn't legal in this state right? It's not really my place to ask, but I assume this is not going to be a real wedding, more of a civil union correct?"

You felt your face flush red as your temper flared up, "I'm not gay! I…" You stopped yourself before you blurted out something you shouldn't. "I mean, yeah I'm a lesbian… but we're probably going to drive to a state where it's legal and have a proper wedding there. She wouldn't have it any other way I'm sure."

You lied about this just to avoid the subject of your true gender to the salesman. In truth, your birth certificate proved you were born a male, and you were fairly certain that didn't count as gay marriage… If they needed more proof you could just lift your skirt and show them first hand. You giggled a bit as you imagined doing this to a priest trying to marry you, and freaking him out.

"I'm sorry if I offended, I'm not used to these kinds of situations. But regardless, I'm sure your girlfriend will appreciate a beautiful ring just like any other girl getting proposed to right? Might I recommend this one…? You could even get a pair, so you have one for yourself…"

They weren't really designed to be engagement rings, but rather they were two beautiful rings for women that would interlock when you clasped your hands with hers. The shape was designed to fit together with a copy of itself when placed opposite, and it ended up looking like two dolphins circling one pink jewel and one white jewel. They weren't diamonds, but they weren't cheap either. The pair set you into debt a decent amount, and you knew you'd never have been able to afford this on a McDonalds wage.

"I can't believe I let him talk me into getting these things…" You said, leaving the mall with your sister.

"Yeah but they're perfect! I really can't wait to see the two of you holding hands with these rings, I think I'll die of cuteness overload." Alex said, much more excited about this than you were.

"And you weren't much help either! You kept telling me how much Alisha would love it, are you sure you weren't getting a cut of the sale from him?" You said, and both of you laughed. "The rings are pretty cute though I gotta say… I don't normally like girly things but, it's growing on me I think."

"Pssh, says the girl in a dress. Can't get much girlier than that sis." Alex stuck her tongue out at you.

"Hey! This is like the least girly dress I could find, it's comfortable ok? I don't like pants… they aren't very comfortable when you have… you know?" You mumbled.

"I know, I'm just teasing. But you keep saying you don't want to be girly, and I don't really believe you. You could just wear baggy pants and dress like a butch lesbian if you wanted to not be girly. But you still wear makeup, you chose to wear a dress instead of baggy pants. I mean your hair is short but if you keep growing it out like this it won't be for long. And now you spent HOW much on a girly pair of rings for yourself and Alisha? Face it sis, you're more girly than you say you are." Alex smiled and started walking ahead of you towards your car.

As you walked, you looked down at yourself and saw a girl with large breasts wearing a summer dress, and walking with an unmistakably feminine gait. Had you been moving this femininely the whole time? Maybe Alex was right… part of you never stopped being feminine even after you returned Alisha to normal. You had thought you returned all of Alisha's feminine personality to her, but… was this something else? Whatever it was, you hadn't even noticed it until now. Your choice of clothing, your personality, and the way you talked, had changed, but not completely. This started to frighten you, that one of your swaps may have left your mind altered more than you thought, and there wasn't much you could do about it now.

A few days past, and you were at school hanging out with your new friend Hannah, and some of your old male friends in the computer lab. You got a call from Alisha that had you running out of the room to talk in private.

"Alisha?! Where have you been is everything ok? I've been trying to get ahold of you! Please tell me your dad didn't hurt you…?" You blurt out all at once when no one was in earshot.

Alisha sounded more or less fine, but you could tell there was something she wasn't saying. "It's ok Billie, calm down! My dad took my phone away and he said some incredibly rude things about you, which I won't repeat, but I finally got my mom to calm him down today. Don't worry about me, I'm not hurt or anything but… I'm more worried about you. You seemed completely shattered by what he said to you, and I have been worried you would take it hard."

"Well I was incredibly hurt… Mark had always been nice to me before… But I realize that's all in the past. A lot of the things he said were true, but Alex did a great job keeping me from wanting to do anything stupid…" You said, thinking of the pair of rings that you had left at home.

Alisha seemed pleased, "That's good, Alex has always been there to anchor you I suppose."

You continued, "So now that you have your phone back… did you want to do anything? I wanted to see this play that’s premiering tonight, I know the lead actress in it, she's a friend of mine apparently. I was hoping you could go with me…"

There was a pause, and then Alisha said, "Sure! I'd love to! I didn't know you were the kind of person to watch plays though?"

"Let's just say it's a recent thing… I kind of owe it to April to at least support her big premiere."

"April huh, you aren't cheating on me are you?" Alisha asked playfully, you could tell she was kidding.

"Not in a million years, trust me she's just a friend. So your dad isn't going to be a problem with you going out tonight?" You asked.

"Let's… not talk about my dad. He doesn't need to know, ok? Please just let me deal with him and don't worry about it. Just… I would recommend avoiding him."

You raced home, wanting to make sure you had enough time to get ready to meet Alisha to see the play, which was turning out to be more like a date. When you got home, you saw Alex lounging around as she had been lately, and suddenly you stopped and felt a bit guilty. You had been holding on to her interest in dancing and clubbing for so long you almost forgot about it. She used to be so active, and though she was still on the cheer leading team, she never seemed very interested in going out with her friends anymore.

You decided to fix this finally, having given up any desire to swap your body back with the girl at the club, you figured you didn't need these interests anymore. With a bit of concentration you found yourself becoming a bit more laid back again, and had a renewed interest in video games and TV and other things that you used to do with Alisha while lounging around at home.

"Hey Alex, I'm going to a play tonight with Alisha, I don't think mom's gonna be home tonight, she won't know if you go out clubbing… I know how long you've been waiting to go dancing with your friend Jen and the others, so tonight might be the perfect night." You told Alex with a wink.

You hoped she would finally have a good time now that her old interests were restored. On the other hand, you found it harder to motivate yourself to go out to this play, but you knew you had to do it for Alisha. You needed to be near her, and you wanted to reassure her that you still wanted to be with her.


Once in your room, you decided to be daring and changed into one of your party dresses that you normally said were way too girly, but you knew that was only your masculinity trying to fight back now. Despite having the mentality of a guy, you'd come to accept that in this reality you WERE a girl, and it was ok to get pleasure from wearing dresses and skirts and even heels. You had the body for it, and you knew how to move like a woman, so it only made sense to stop fighting it.

You slipped into the metallic blue flared dress that you knew would look amazing on your body, and would hopefully impress Alisha, but it still took some effort to convince yourself that it was ok. You were quite glad that you had shaved your legs this morning as well, since this dress was quite short. Don't worry, you aren't going to emasculate yourself just because you're wearing a girly dress, you already look like a girl everywhere else for fuck's sake! You thought to yourself.

You decided to wear a pair of sandals with a low heel, despite being about 5 foot 10 inches without any shoes on, because you felt like the sandals went well with the dress. You had no problem walking in them, you found, because you still possessed knowledge of wearing clothes like these your whole life, due to one of the previous swaps you couldn't remember. Or maybe it was a combination of swaps, it didn't matter. This dress made you feel confident in your appearance again, and you needed all the confidence you could get after you gave most of it back to April.

You used all the makeup tips you learned from working as Sandi's assistant to make yourself look presentable, but made sure not to go overboard. You still weren't too confident in your makeup abilities, and figured right now less was more. Your hair was still quite short in a pixie cut, so it was easy to style, but you made sure to give it an intentionally messy but feminine look that would go well with the dress.

Lastly, you decided to bring a purse, since it was a nice event and everyone saw you as a woman anyways, you might as well complete the look. Plus you needed a place to put the box containing the pair of rings you wanted to have just in case the right moment presented itself. Once you had that ready, you made sure your penis was safely tucked away in your panties, and wouldn't come loose, because this dress would not conceal it very well…

You took a deep breath and told yourself, "Well… here goes nothing…"

After you snapped a selfie with April, you looked back at the previous photos on your phone, and noticed the photo you'd taken during the dress rehearsal, but now the photo was different… Instead of you dressed up in costume, the photo was now of you and April, taking a picture as friends. You were no longer dressed up in the photo, but April was looking as beautiful as ever.

"Strange… Oh right! April I have a favor to ask of you…" You said, "I'm planning to propose to Alisha tonight."

"How do you know how the script goes?"

"Don't worry about that, just take the rings and…" And you explain to her what she should do.

Now that was taken care of, you hoped April took good care of the rings. You finally met up with Alisha who was waiting outside in the cold, and you profusely apologized for making her wait. She was looking beautiful tonight, and had decided to wear a nice dress as well, similar to the one you were wearing.

"Wow Billie, look at you! Finally wearing one of those sexy party dresses are you? I knew you were hiding those in the back of your closet for a while…" Alisha teased.

"Hey you're one to talk, you look absolutely stunning. Are you ready to get seated?" You asked her.

She nodded and you decided to enter the theater with arms locked together, like a couple, not afraid to let people know you were in love. You had a seat in the front row, making sure April could see you from the stage when she got up.

The play went just like you expected, and you weren't sure but you thought April was actually a better actress than you remembered being when you had all her abilities. Her singing voice blew yours out of the water during the musical parts, and she had a lot less restraint when it came to the lovey dovey scenes. She was performing great, just as you had expected.

You watched Alisha a lot through the play, watching her reactions to things. Towards the end of the play when April's character got married to the prince, Alisha was resting her head on your shoulder from the seat next to you, and you rubbed her leg lovingly with your soft hand.

At the end of the scene the crowd cheered and there was a standing ovation. The actors and actresses all came out onto the stage and took a bow together. You were wondering when it was time, and your heart was pounding. You didn't want to make this a public spectacle, but at this rate you knew that everyone would be watching if she did it soon. After they all took a bow, April walked to the front of the stage in her character's wedding gown, and looked at you with a wink.

"Thank you all for coming, and we have one last special occasion tonight. After that lovely wedding scene, I thought we might have one more." April announced to the crowd who were now intrigued.

From back stage, someone brought out a fancy cushion with a tiny box sitting on top of it, and handed it to April. She clicked her heels down the steps towards the audience, and stopped at your seat, handing the box off to you.

"Good luck!" She whispered.

As the entire crowd was now focused on you, your heart was pounding. You didn't have the courage you once had when you had the confidence of an actress. You would have to get through this the old fashioned way. You took the box and looked at Alisha, who already guessed what was happening. Then you went down on one knee and opened the box. You almost stumbled a bit, getting on one knee in heels was difficult, but you managed.

As you tried to speak, you had trouble finding the words, and they stuck in your throat…
1231122131323111121112231221231232121221.title: The play goes smoothly you plan to propose to A...

1231122131323111121112231221231232121221.content:
Alisha saw the box with two identical rings inside, and knew immediately what was going on. Before you could even get any words out, Alisha blurted, "Yes, yes, yes! Of course I'll marry you!"

And with that she lunged at you and kissed you for the entire theater to see. Your heart was fluttering more than you'd ever experienced, and you were glad that you hadn't even had to say it! Alisha knew you well enough that you were terrified of speaking in public, and she took the burden off of you. The two of you each took a ring out of the box and placed it on your fingers. You showed her that when you two locked your hands together, the rings looked like they were locking together to form a pair of love birds. She adored it and kissed you even harder, while still locking hands.

Once the audience realized what was happening, they began cheering and clapping for you. Most of them didn't even see that it was what appeared to be a woman proposing to another woman, but they just cheered because everyone else was cheering. The people next to you looked confused at first, but were kind enough to give you your happy moment. A few in the audience who saw you were disapproving, but the cheers drowned out their silent protest.

"I love you Alisha, I didn't want to do this to your family but I can't live without you…" You told her after coming up for air from the long kiss.

"I thought you'd never ask Billie…" Alisha said with a sweet smile. Then she leaned into your ear to whisper so the crowd couldn’t hear. "I was going to tell you after the play, but you stole the spotlight! I'm pregnant!"

You saw her face beaming with pride and the two of you embraced and kissed in front of everyone. Eventually people began filing out of the theater, a few of them came up and congratulating you for being such a brave lesbian couple to do this in public. You simply smiled and thanked them, knowing that you'd have to just go along with being called a lesbian for quite a while.

A few guys stuck around after most of the crowd left, and were giving you dirty looks, so you made sure to avoid them. Eventually April decided to yank you back stage so you were not drawing any more attention of people like that.

"Congratulations you two! I wasn't sure if that would be very impressive but I think it worked out in the end." April said, still wearing the costume wedding gown.

"Thanks! You must be April then, the friend Billie told me about. I had no idea you were the star of the show, and that you were in on this! But did you have to make such a spectacle out of it? Billie looked terrified with all those people watching!" Alisha joked.

"Actually it was her idea, she wanted it to be a special moment for you. Billie obviously doesn't handle crowds very well, but I think she managed!"

"Yeah… Thank you for helping, April, that turned out a lot better than I planned. The idea sounded pretty dumb in my head, but you pulled it off amazingly!" You thanked her.

"Oh it was brilliant Billie don't worry. I hadn't planned on coming out of the closet today, but if I had to that was a beautiful way to do it." Alisha said with a smile.

"Coming out of the closet…? Alisha…" You started.

"We're publicly lesbians remember? Or did you forget?" She said nudging you with her elbow.

"Oh right, yeah lesbians… Total dykes here!" You awkwardly laughed, as April gave the two of you a funny look. "You know once your belly starts showing we're going to have to tell people the truth, or they're going to wonder…"

April's eyes went wide, "Belly showing? No way… Billie is your girlfriend, I mean fiancée pregnant? Who is the father?"

"I am…" You mumbled. "Please don't tell anyone yet. I'd rather they think I was a dyke than… what I really am."

April covered her mouth in shock, "Oh my god I'm so sorry, I had no idea. I wasn't trying to offend you or-"

"It's ok I chose this life! I had the means to return to normal and I decided not to. This path might be more difficult, but it's who I truly am and I can't deny that." You explained.

By now you firmly believed that this reality was where you wanted to stay. As a result of the many swaps you put yourself through, you had accidentally left yourself with the body image of a woman without realizing it, and had convinced yourself that these were your true feelings. You were happiest looking female, and in this reality Alisha accepted you for who you were, because she loved you. When she had been a man, and you a shemale, neither of you could bear children and your relationship was strained. But now you had the means to provide her with a child, and all she wanted was for you to be the father… or second mother… or whatever.

You and Alisha plan the wedding to not include her father.
1231122131323111121112231221231232121221.content:
Two days had passed since you got engaged to Alisha, and life had gone at a whirlwind pace since then. Alisha's father quickly found out that his daughter was engaged to you, who he still believed to be a disgusting shemale that was corrupting Alisha. He was furious when you came there yourself with Alisha to break the news… that is until he found out that Alisha was pregnant… with your child. Her father, Mark, was speechless, and his wife had to step in and calm him down. You had been afraid the news about the pregnancy would make him even more angry, but it seemed to break down his walls.

"Alisha… pregnant? And you're the 'father' correct?" Mark asked, putting air quotes around 'father'.

"Yes sir, and… I proposed to her before I found out about this… it was news to me to, but I plan on raising this child the best I can, like any father or mother could." You said, nervously trying to find the right answer he was looking for. You decided to bite your tongue and hold back any comments about his behavior towards you in the past.

Mark sat down in his chair and put his head in his hands, before looking to Alisha. "Do you know if it's a boy or a girl?"

"It's way too early to tell, Dad, I only just started testing positive. And before you say anything, I am carrying this child all the way to birth. Abortion is NOT an option. This is my child and I intend to give birth to it." Alisha said, standing firm and giving her father the ultimatum.

"What? No, no… Alisha I will never ask you to do something like that. I'm going to be a grandfather, don't you see? Your mother is going to be a grandma, do you have any idea how happy this makes her? She's already thinking about baby gifts and there's still 9 months to go!" Mark said, laughing for the first time you'd seen him laugh since your changes.

Alisha had been on the verge of crying during the whole conversation, "So you're not mad? What about the wedding? What will we tell people? You're always worried about what other people think of the family…"

Mark gave you a glare, but he held back saying anything nasty. "If the state allows a wedding between you two, then who am I to stop it? My daughter obviously loves you Billie. Now I'm not sure whether to call you my son-in-law or daughter-in-law…"

"Just Billie is fine…" You said, gritting your teeth, not wanting a bigot like him to try and get friendly with you.

Alisha jumped in, "Dad, Billie identifies as a woman, so I would say daughter-in-law suits her. But the law recognizes her as being born male, and legally still is since she's never gotten an operation to change her gender. She was capable of impregnating me if that tells you anything about how male she is."

You blushed, embarrassed that Alisha was talking about all of this so freely to her family.

Mark snorted, "I'll take your word for it Alisha… Well if you insist on having this wedding, then you can count on me not coming.""What?! But you said you supported us?" Alisha cried.

"I said I wouldn't STOP you, I didn't say I would show my face there. If you and your girly boyfriend want to have a fancy wedding with double the wedding dresses, then be my guest. But I won't be there, and I WON'T be paying for it." Mark yelled.

"Dad!" Alisha yelled back, "You have to be there, you're my father!"

"Let your mother go in my place, since it seems to be an all-girls wedding anyways. I wouldn't belong. I think this discussion is over." Mark said as he got up and left the room.

Alisha looked at you with tears in her eyes, and embraced you. You stroked her hair and patted her back. "If it means anything to you, that went better than I expected." You told her.

1231122131323111121112231221231232121221.content:
After the intense meeting with Alisha's father, her mother, Helen, agreed to help with the plans, since her husband was being so stubborn. She was much more accepting of your condition than Mark was, and was simply happy that her daughter was getting married, it didn't matter what gender you were. She was simply glad you were a respectful and kind person.

Your own family was much easier to get along with. Your parents were not often around the house lately, and it was mostly yourself and Alex fending for yourselves at home, but when you finally told them you were engaged to marry your girlfriend, they were in full support of you. The news of the pregnancy was even more icing on the cake, as they had always wanted a grandchild, and expected Alex to be the one to give them one. They hadn't even been sure your male parts were fertile and capable of producing viable sperm, but it turns out you could! Apparently a lifetime of hormone treatment to become female hadn't damaged your ability to reproduce, luckily.

With the help of your parents and Alisha's mother, you had all decided the wedding should be soon. The main reason was the pregnancy. They didn't want Alisha's baby bump to be showing in her wedding dress, and it was a race against the clock for that which would likely be in less than a month. You wanted to try and win over her father before the wedding, to make sure he would show up. It meant the world to Alisha to have her wedding go well, and you were determined to make this happen.

The next day you were working at your job as a hair stylist assistant, and you were talking to the various women that came in to get their hair done. You explained to them your situation that you were getting married, to another woman (you had decided to let them assume you were a lesbian), and that her father didn't approve of your marriage and wouldn't attend the wedding.

A very understanding older woman suggested to you, "If only her father understood that love between two women is just as strong as love between a man and a woman, if not stronger in some cases. He sounds like an old man set in his ways, and it's too bad he can't see things from your perspective…"

You smiled at her as you washed her hair, "Thank you, I'll keep that advice in mind… maybe I can make him understand."

Despite the change of tone, Mark wont show up to the wedding...
1231122131323111121112231221231232121221.content:
You decided to test the limits of your swapping powers, by swapping over a long distance. You knew Mark would be at home like he always was, and you could imagine in your head, the path you would take to drive there. You hoped that would be enough.

You decided to try a small swap to make sure reality didn't change in any major way. One of your customers today was an older woman who was well past her prime, but had always been rather rude to you. She dressed nice however, and kept her body in good shape despite her age, which was probably close to Mark's.

You focused on the woman's sense of fashion and clothing style, and switched it with Mark, trying to focus on where he was. In a second, the woman was now wearing a pair of regular fit jean and sneakers, with a men's style T-shirt that had been shrunk to fit her frame. It all looked a bit out of place on her, but it wasn't terribly out of place. It must have been much worse for Mark right now, if reality hadn't changed so that he'd always worn women's clothing…

You loaded up Facebook on your phone, and browsed to Alisha's page, and found a picture of her and her father, but now her father was wearing a dress and black leather flats, obviously of a feminine design. You noticed he had even grown his hair out longer in this reality. When you saw his face, it brought back memories of how he'd treated you and Alisha before, and how different he used to be before all of this happened. You couldn't control the anger it brought up in you, and it took all of your strength to not give the man a saggy old vagina. You knew this could mean Alisha might have never been born however, and that was something you absolutely wanted to avoid.

Instead you focused on the older woman's aging breasts which were surely sagging over the years. The woman probably had beautiful ample breasts in her day, but now gravity had taken their toll on them, and they weren't what they once were. Now that you'd transferred her clothes to Mark, she was no longer wearing a bra, and the effects of gravity became even more obvious. Once you focused on transferring her breasts, you witnessed her sagging breasts vanish, replaced by Mark's broader flat male chest.

With a quick glance on Facebook, you confirmed that Mark now had breasts in all of his pictures. Hopefully this would be enough to change his perspective on life, and let him see things your way.


That afternoon, after you got off school, you stopped by Alisha's house, and asked to talk to Mark. Alisha seemed to be in a better mood today, and had even given you a deep kiss at the front door, which she tended to avoid around her father. When Mark came to greet you, it was like a whole new person. Alisha's father was now a public cross dresser apparently, and was currently unashamed of wearing a dress, and his older breasts were clearly seen pushing outwards.

You were shocked most of all by his reaction to you, "Hey there Billie, it's good to see you again."

Wait, was he actually nice to me for once? You thought to yourself. "Oh hi, yeah… Listen I wanted to talk about the wedding."

1231122131323111121112231221231232121221.content:
"You know, I have some ideas about the wedding," Mark said. "Take a seat so we can discuss it."

You took a seat on the couch and Mark took a seat opposite you on a chair. Even though Mark wore a dress he didn't sit like a lady. He still held himself as a man. His legs were spread far apart and he was leaning forward towards you with his hands on his knees. His entire posture was wrong for the apparel he was wearing. But worse than that, his look wasn't completely female. True he wore a dress, and was wearing stockings (or pantyhose you couldn't be sure which.) He also had on earrings and a feminine watch and several rings on his fingers. But he didn't wear any makeup and his nails weren't manicured, let alone polished. Even though his hair was a bit longer than usually it was styled in a masculine fashion. His dress was sleeveless so you could see the hair on his arms and the bushy armpits. Under his hose you could also see a mat of hair.

You had given Mark the woman's fashion sense but that only applied to his clothing and jewelry, not his posture nor the other little tricks a woman uses to make herself pretty. You determined that if that woman was rude to you one more time, that you would swap all of these traits too. Then you wouldn't have to put up with her anymore. If she had her hair done in a masculine style she wouldn't go to your salon but to a barber.

Mark had several suggestions for the wedding, mostly things about what type of dress you and Alisha should wear. But you were too distracted by his masculine gestures and hairy armpits to pay too much attention. You simply nodded in all the right places and told him you would consider what he said. You hoped that rude woman would return to the salon before the wedding so you could help Mark project a more feminine appearance to go with his wardrobe.

1231122131323111121112231221231232121221.content:
After Mark gave you a series of suggestions about what kind of dresses should be worn, you realized many of his suggestions were actually pretty good. The lady's fashion sense he acquired had good taste, at least as far as weddings were concerned. He wouldn't have any clue how to dress like someone your age, but he at least knew his wedding dresses, which were usually quite traditional and old fashioned anyways.

You smiled at his advice, "Thank you for the suggestions Mark, I'm glad we're getting along again! And as for both me and Alisha wearing wedding gowns, I don't know if she'd have it any other way. She would kill me if I showed up in a tuxedo or something! But don't worry, my parents are going to help out with that and we should have everything sorted out!"

You pushed aside the awkward thought of Mark wearing a dress of his own to your wedding, and wished you had given him more womanly features. Despite his behavior being radically changed, you still weren't satisfied. Mark had left a bad taste in your mouth, and you wanted to take things further… You were in luck, the next day the woman returned, and in a terribly bitchy mood as well. She insisted that you had messed up the dye in her hair, which was once again showing gray at the roots. You knew that it wasn't even you who had dyed her hair, in fact the dye job was done months ago before you started working as an assistant in this reality. The previous day she had just come in for a trim…

"Listen, I'm sorry miss but dye isn't permanent, you're going to have to get it reapplied." You said, trying to remain calm.

She huffed and acted insulted, "Well! I will just have to find another salon who isn't using cheap dye to get people to keep coming back! I'm not coming back here again!"

You smiled to yourself as that was all you needed to hear. You concentrated on Mark, sitting in his house wearing her clothing, probably watching old TV reruns of shows from the 70's and 80's. You first swapped the woman's feminine mannerisms and behavior, and then her slimmer body type, so that he wouldn't look entirely like a man in a dress. He already had her breasts, so the only thing left was to swap her hair and makeup, which was usually quite well done since she came to your salon to have it done often.

With a quick check of your phone, you made sure Alisha hadn't been affected by the change, and sure enough, she still looked fine and, she was in many more photos with her father now, who looked very womanly now. Her father essentially looked like a 50 year old woman, who spent a lot of time at the salon and primping. If you didn't know better, you'd think Alisha had two mothers…

Is this what Alisha and I will look like in 30 years? Two older ladies, one secretly with a penis…? They do look like a happy couple though… happier than before even. You thought, as you looked through Alisha's family photos on her Facebook page.

You remembered how much Mark and Helen used to fight, and it would show whenever they took pictures, as he would be very stoic and rarely smiled when in a photo with her. Even before you got your powers, in your original reality, he hadn't been entirely on good terms with his wife, but he was always nice to you as Alisha's boyfriend. When you looked at these photos however, he was smiling a lot more, hugging his wife and generally looked happy to be around her. Maybe this change that you made out of anger would help their marriage in the long run, now that they had much more to relate about.
1231122131323111121112231221231232121221.title: Happy day, the rude woman returns

Mark comes through the surgery like a champ, wedding is back on track
1231122131323111121112231221231232121221.content:
Mark phones you up and says he has to see you and Alisha right away. You didn't know what this was all about but you arranged to come to Mark right after your last class. You wanted to come earlier, but your days were still busy with your apprenticeship at the salon and your full class schedule.

When you got there, you noticed immediately the change in Mark's appearance and mannerisms. he didn't move like a man anymore, his walk was much more graceful. He had you and Alisha sit down on the couch and he took a seat in front of you and Alisha. There was a serious look on his painted face.

Sitting in front of you, he was leaning forward, but his legs were together with his feet crossed at the ankles. His arms were bent at the elbow but his hands hung loosely from his wrists. He still wore a sleeveless dress, (it was still the warm part of the year) but his arms and particularly his armpits were now completely hairless. But even more than simply being hairless, his skin was softer because of a lifetime of using oils and lotions on it. His hands were much more expressive when he talked, often touching you and Alisha in a reassuring manner when he wanted to make a point.

"Honey...Billie, I guess you wanted to know why I asked you here."

"Yes, Daddy," Alisha said for both of you.

"Well I just came from the doctor today....there is no way to put this easily. I have breast cancer."

"Oh my god," you and Alisha said in unison.

"But they did catch it early and I'll be fine. But I will have to have a full mastectomy."

"Do you really have such a radical procedure? I heard they could just do a lumpectomy instead of a something like that."

"Well, I have a gene that makes breast cancer very likely in my family. The doctor thought it would be best."

"Are you going to get a second opinion?"

"No, I am going to make the best of a bad situation and I am going to get a nice new set of boobs. I'll look even better in my dress when I come to the wedding."

"But the wedding is in less than four weeks."

"I'm having the surgery done on Monday, I should be OK by then. I'll be on chemo-therapy. But don't worry, it'll be like a crash diet. I had wanted to lose a few pounds anyway."

You were amazed, even though Mark had cancer, he was so upbeat. Looking for the silver lining in everything. Then you suggested, "Why don't we postpone the wedding for a month."

"You don't have to do that,"

Alisha agreed, "But we want to. This was all rather rushed anyway. It'll be better to wait another month."

"But what about the baby bump?"

"I'll get a gown with lots of petticoats, no one will know where I end and the dress begins, it'll be fine."

Then Mark got up and you and Alisha did too and had a loving group hug. It was then that you thought, that maybe you would swap breasts with Mark and another woman. But you didn't think it was right to give someone else cancer knowingly. Mark said that he would be alright. Besides maybe he would be right, he would look great with firmer boobs and losing a few pounds.
1231122131323111121112231221231232121221.title: You learn about a problem with Mark in this new...
